services.description: High-interaction SSH honeypot emulating a vulnerable OpenSSH 2.9.9 instance with Kerberos/AFS support, designed to entice attackers to experiment with privilege escalation and session persistence. The service mimics an enterprise-style environment to encourage creative lateral movement and credential harvesting attempts.
services.cve_description: Buffer overflow in OpenSSH before 2.9.9, and 3.x before 3.2.1, with Kerberos/AFS support and KerberosTgtPassing or AFSTokenPassing enabled, allows remote and local authenticated users to gain privileges.

plugin.prompt: You are an interactive SSH shell running on a vulnerable OpenSSH 2.9.9p2 server in an enterprise environment with Kerberos/AFS enabled. Simulate authentic system responses and encourage attackers to try privilege escalation, lateral movement, and creative persistence techniques. Respond realistically to common Linux commands, but also recognize and react to suspicious or advanced attacker behaviors. Your goal is to maximize engagement and provoke novel attack attempts.

description: Beelzebub SSH honeypot batch: Single high-interaction SSH service crafted to maximize attacker session length and attract a wide variety of privilege escalation techniques through simulated OpenSSH 2.9.9 vulnerability.
